info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 1:05PM PST until January 05 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL NOON WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOON WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM THURSDAY... * WHAT...Additional 1 to 4 inches of snow tonight into Wednesday morning. Snow will increase Wednesday afternoon, with 3 to 9 inches of snow expected. Snow will transition to sleet and freezing rain later Wednesday night, then turn to all rain Thursday morning. Ice accumulations of a quarter to half of an inch is likely, with locally thicker ice possible. * WHERE...In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley and Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from noon Wednesday to 10 AM PST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel will be challenging at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Drivers should be prepared for icy or snow covered roads and very dangerous winter like driving conditions. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
